reviewText: A gift for grandkids but I know they will enjoy this thank you

This particular Christmas compilation is a 4-disc DVD set of the recent Remastered Deluxe Editions of 4 Rankin/Bass Christmas classics, owned by the WB; 'Twas the Night Before Christmas in 1974, Frosty's Winter Wonderland in 1976, Jack Frost in 1979 (never on authorized DVDs before 2008), and the piece de resistance, The First Christmas: The Story of the First Christmas Snow in 1975 (never on DVD at all before 2012)! Each and every one of these DVDs contain bonus programs, but not extra specials; each of the 4 specials to its own DVD. If you don't already have these classics on DVD, this 4-disc set's a great idea to save money and shelf space. If only the DVD case wasn't a stackable one; consult Amazon or ebay for empty 4-disc DVD cases that don't stack the discs on top of each other! DVDs or any other discs like that, can get scratched up real easy stacked in a single notch. By the way, people of all ages have enjoyed all 4 of these classics for generations, not just children; so don't let the case's labeling at the top front cover fool you! Merry Christmas in July, everybody!
The frost snowman film is not the original as thought... otherwise, decent with 4 short films for kids
Christmas present for grandkids and they loved it.
Paw Paw sends the best movies always, he loves them, that makes them awesome.
Great deal. Fast shipping. Perfect combination of holiday classics.
absolutely adore the fact the First Christmas Snow is part of this pack.  This was the special I'd been looking for a long time.  Little Lucas is so memorable, at least for me.
